summary.para: Compares the attributes on this object with the attributes on another object.

param.name: pTheirs
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the object to compare with this object.

param.name: MatchType
param.para: Member of the enumeration, specifying the type of comparison to make.

param.name: pbResult
param.para: Receives a Boolean value. The value is TRUE if the two sets of attributes match in the way specified by the MatchType parameter. Otherwise, the value is FALSE.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.

remarks.para: If pThis is the object whose Compare method is called, and pTheirs is the object passed in as the pTheirs parameter, the following comparisons are defined by MatchType.

listheader.description: Returns TRUE if and only if

item.description: For every attribute in pThis, an attribute with the same key and value exists in pTheirs.
For every attribute in pTheirs, an attribute with the same key and value exists in pThis.
The key/value pairs are identical in both objects.
Take the intersection of the keys in pThis and the keys in pTheirs. The values associated with those keys are identical in both pThis and pTheirs.
Take the object with the smallest number of attributes. For every attribute in that object, an attribute with the same key and value exists in the other object.

remarks.para: The pTheirs and pbResult parameters must not be NULL. If either parameter is NULL, an access violation occurs.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Queries whether a stored attribute value equals to a specified PROPVARIANT.

param.name: guidKey
param.para: GUID that identifies which value to query.

param.name: Value
param.para: PROPVARIANT that contains the value to compare.

param.name: pbResult
param.para: Receives a Boolean value indicating whether the attribute matches the value given in Value. See Remarks. This parameter must not be NULL. If this parameter is NULL, an access violation occurs.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.

remarks.para: The method sets pbResult to FALSE for any of the following reasons:

description.para: No attribute is found whose key matches the one given in guidKey.
The attribute's PROPVARIANT type does not match the type given in Value.
The attribute value does not match the value given in Value.
The method fails.

remarks.para: Otherwise, the method sets pbResult to TRUE.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Retrieves a byte array associated with a key. This method allocates the memory for the array.

param.name: guidKey
param.para: GUID that identifies which value to retrieve. The attribute type must be MF_ATTRIBUTE_BLOB.

param.name: ppBuf
param.para: If the key is found and the value is a byte array, this parameter receives a copy of the array. The caller must free the memory for the array by calling .

param.name: pcbSize
param.para: Receives the size of the array, in bytes.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.
The specified key was not found.
The attribute value is not a byte array.

remarks.para: To copy a byte array value into a caller-allocated buffer, use the method.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

member.name: IMFAttributes.GetAllocatedString

summary.para: Gets a wide-character string associated with a key. This method allocates the memory for the string.

param.name: guidKey
param.para: A GUID that identifies which value to retrieve. The attribute type must be MF_ATTRIBUTE_STRING.

param.name: ppwszValue
param.para: If the key is found and the value is a string type, this parameter receives a copy of the string. The caller must free the memory for the string by calling .

param.name: pcchLength
param.para: Receives the number of characters in the string, excluding the terminating NULL character. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.
The specified key was not found.
The attribute value is not a string.

member.remarks:
To copy a string value into a caller-allocated buffer, use the method.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:
Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.
Note An earlier version of the documentation incorrectly stated that the pcchLength parameter can be NULL. Setting this parameter to NULL might succeed in some cases, but is not guaranteed. The caller must pass a non-NULL pointer for this parameter.

summary.para: Retrieves a byte array associated with a key. This method copies the array into a caller-allocated buffer.

param.name: guidKey
param.para: GUID that identifies which value to retrieve. The attribute type must be MF_ATTRIBUTE_BLOB.

param.name: pBuf
param.para: Pointer to a buffer allocated by the caller. If the key is found and the value is a byte array, the method copies the array into this buffer. To find the required size of the buffer, call .

param.name: cbBufSize
param.para: The size of the pBuf buffer, in bytes.

param.name: pcbBlobSize
param.para: Receives the size of the byte array. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.
The buffer is not large enough to the array.
The specified key was not found.
The attribute value is not a byte array.

remarks.para: You can also use the method, which allocates the buffer to hold the byte array.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

param.para: If the key is found and the value is a byte array, this parameter receives the size of the array, in bytes.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.
The specified key was not found.
The attribute value is not a byte array.

remarks.para: To get the byte array, call .

summary.para: Retrieves the value associated with a key.

param.name: guidKey
param.para: A GUID that identifies which value to retrieve.

param.name: pValue
param.para: A pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the value. The method fills the PROPVARIANT with a copy of the stored value, if the value is found. Call PropVariantClear to free the memory allocated by this method. This parameter can be NULL. If this parameter is NULL, the method searches for the key and returns S_OK if the key is found, but does not copy the value.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.
The specified key was not found.

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

summary.para: Retrieves an attribute at the specified index.

param.name: unIndex
param.para: Index of the attribute to retrieve. To get the number of attributes, call .

param.name: pguidKey
param.para: Receives the GUID that identifies this attribute.

param.name: pValue
param.para: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the value. This parameter can be NULL. If it is not NULL, the method fills the PROPVARIANT with a copy of the attribute value. Call PropVariantClear to free the memory allocated by this method.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.
Invalid index.

remarks.para: To enumerate all of an object's attributes in a thread-safe way, do the following:

description.para: Call to prevent another thread from adding or deleting attributes.
Call to find the number of attributes.
Call GetItemByIndex to get each attribute by index.
Call to unlock the attribute store.

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

summary.para: Retrieves a wide-character string associated with a key.

param.name: guidKey
param.para: GUID that identifies which value to retrieve. The attribute type must be MF_ATTRIBUTE_STRING.

param.name: pwszValue
param.para: Pointer to a wide-character array allocated by the caller. The array must be large enough to hold the string, including the terminating NULL character. If the key is found and the value is a string type, the method copies the string into this buffer. To find the length of the string, call .

param.name: cchBufSize
param.para: The size of the pwszValue array, in characters. This value includes the terminating NULL character.

param.name: pcchLength
param.para: Receives the number of characters in the string, excluding the terminating NULL character. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.
The length of the string is too large to fit in a UINT32 value.
The buffer is not large enough to hold the string.
The specified key was not found.
The attribute value is not a string.

remarks.para: You can also use the method, which allocates the buffer to hold the string.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

summary.para: Locks the attribute store so that no other thread can access it. If the attribute store is already locked by another thread, this method blocks until the other thread unlocks the object. After calling this method, call to unlock the object.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.

remarks.para: This method can cause a deadlock if a thread that calls LockStore waits on a thread that calls any other methods on the same object.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

summary.para: Adds an attribute value with a specified key.

param.name: guidKey
param.para: A GUID that identifies the value to set. If this key already exists, the method overwrites the old value.

param.name: Value
param.para: A PROPVARIANT that contains the attribute value. The method copies the value. The PROPVARIANT type must be one of the types listed in the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The method succeeded.
Insufficient memory.
Invalid attribute type.

remarks.para: This method checks whether the PROPVARIANT type is one of the attribute types defined in , and fails if an unsupported type is used. However, this method does not check whether the PROPVARIANT is the correct type for the specified attribute GUID. (There is no programmatic way to associate attribute GUIDs with property types.) For a list of Media Foundation attributes and their data types, see Media Foundation Attributes.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Provides a generic way to store key/value pairs on an object. The keys are GUIDs, and the values can be any of the following data types: UINT32, UINT64, double, GUID, wide-character string, byte array, or IUnknown pointer. The standard implementation of this interface holds a thread lock while values are added, deleted, or retrieved.

For a list of predefined attribute GUIDs, see Media Foundation Attributes. Each attribute GUID has an expected data type. The various "set" methods in IMFAttributes do not validate the type against the attribute GUID. It is the application's responsibility to set the correct type for the attribute.
To create an empty attribute store, call .

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.
